newsitem.title: NIGER: Niger opposition forms front to push for democracy.
newsitem.headline: Niger opposition forms front to push for democracy.

text.p: Opposition parties in Niger have formed a united front to campaign for democracy and challenge the rule of President Ibrahim Bare Mainssara, a spokesman said on Sunday.

The opposition contests the results of the May 7-8 presidential election during which Mainassara, who seized power in a coup last January, sacked the electoral commission and appointed a new body which declared him the winner.
A statement by the country's eight opposition parties said they had agreed on Saturday to form a Front for the Restoration and Defence of Democracy (FRDD).

"The illegitimate nature of the regime in power today constitutes the principal obstacle in the way of a rebound in economic activity and the improvement of the lives of the people," the statement added.
Mainassara's four civilian opponents spent two weeks under house arrest after the elections and the Supreme Court rejected a request by three of them to scrap the results.
Niger's three main opposition parties plan to boycott parliamentary elections on November 10 unless the presidential ballot was cancelled.
Mainassara seized power in January, ending a paralysing 16-month political standoff between civilian president Mahamane Ousmane and his opponents who held the majority in parliament.
The new 83-seat parliament to be elected in November will replace the military National Salvation Council appointed by Mainassara after the coup.
